items.title: Colts' Ward had concussion symptoms for weeks
items.summary: Colts cornerback Charvarius Ward said he was "knocked out" and experienced severe symptoms for weeks after he was concussed during a violent pre-game collision on Oct. 12.

items.title: Texans' D thumps Bills, stakes claim as NFL's best
items.summary: Against one of the NFL's top offenses, the Texans showed why they have the No. 1-ranked defense, sacking Josh Allen eight times and forcing three turnovers in a 23-19 win.

items.title: NFL Player Prop Picks: Week 12 Best Bets
items.summary: Matthew Stafford is in the midst of a career year, and the veteran gunslinger will continue to shine against a weak Tampa Bay passing defense on primetime.

items.title: The Chargers Are Failing Justin Herbert
items.summary: Since entering the NFL in 2020, Justin Herbert has been nothing short of historically great. He was unexpectedly thrust into the starting role early in his rookie season, and he ran with it. He won Offensive Rookie of the Year among one of the greatest quarterback classes of all time, setting records along the way. […] The post The Chargers Are Failing Justin Herbert appeared first on The Lead.

items.title: Colts CB Charvarius Ward Sr. on return from concussion: 'I feel like me again'
items.summary: Charvarius Ward Sr. cleared concussion protocol this week and is line to return against the Kansas City Chiefs in his first game since sustaining a concussion he described as "scary" prior to the Colts' Week 6 win over the Arizona Cardinals.

items.title: Daniel Jones, Charvarius Ward full go for Colts’ trip to Kansas City
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The quarterback and cornerback are good to go. As the Indianapolis Colts eye Sunday’s showdown with the Kansas City Chiefs in Arrowhead Stadium, they’ll have the services of Daniel Jones and Charvarius Ward. Jones was a full participant Friday’s practice after being limited Thursday when he experienced discomfort with his fibula. The Colts [...]

items.title: Colts do not rule out any players for Week 12 game vs. Kansas City Chiefs; CB Charvarius Ward Sr. clears concussion protocol
items.summary: The Colts opened Ward's 21-day window to be activated from injured reserve on Wednesday, and Ward participated in all three practices this week.

items.title: What is the backup plan if Daniel Jones can’t go for the Colts?
items.summary: Let’s make this a quick article. There is no backup plan if Daniel Jones gets injured. Zero. The backup plan, as flawed as it may be, is currently healing a broken orbital bone after being smacked in the face during pregame warmups. That was it. That was the whole plan if Jones went down at […]

items.title: Indianapolis Colts: My Cause My Cleats
items.summary: When the Indianapolis Colts take the field on Nov. 30 against the Houston Texans, their shoes will stand out. Players will sport unique footwear as part of the NFL's My Cause My Cleats program. Expect unusual color combinations and charities close to players' hearts. His 13.8% open-target rate is […]

items.title: Despite expanding game, the superpower of Colts’ Alec Pierce is getting deep
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Listen to those around him, and Alec Pierce has spent the last four seasons expanding his game. The renowned home run hitter was committed to adding layers to his game. Pierce wanted to be an intermediate threat, which meant mastering the entire route tree: curls, slants, outs, the works. With one overriding caveat: [...]

items.title: Sauce Gardner, Daniel Jones and a lesson about the NFL Draft
items.summary: Colts defensive backs coach Jerome Henderson did extensive research on Sauce Gardner in 2022, while head coach Shane Steichen scouted Daniel Jones in 2019. Neither coach was with the Colts at the time, but the work they did three and six years ago has paid off in 2025.

items.title: Tyler Warren is on pace for 1,000 yards, but impact on Colts' offense goes well beyond passing game

items.title: Report: Charvarius Ward and Jaylon Carlies designated to return from IR
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — Indianapolis Colts head coach Shane Steichen revealed to local media this morning that defenders Charvarius Ward and Jaylon Carlies have both been designated to return from injured reserve, opening their 21-day practice window. They can be activated at any time over the next three weeks. Lou Anarumo’s defense will potentially add a […]

At 8-2, they’re the No. 3 seed in the AFC – New England and Denver are 9-2 – and are atop [...]

items.title: Colts return from bye week focused on Kansas City Chiefs, not previous accomplishments
items.summary: The Colts re-convened at the Indiana Farm Bureau Football Center on Monday not satisfied with being 8-2, and with their focus firmly shifting to Sunday's matchup with the Chiefs in Kansas City.

items.title: Bill Brooks' Breakdown: Jonathan Taylor's historic season, Sauce Gardner's arrival and the importance of the bye week
items.summary: Colts Ring of Honor wide receiver Bill Brooks gives his perspective on Jonathan Taylor’s historic performance so far this season, what Sauce Gardner’s arrival means and how crucial the Colts’ bye week was before the last seven games of the regular season.

items.summary: The Jaguars are now 6-4 and the Texans are 5-5; the Colts remain atop the division with an 8-2 record after the bye week.

items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – DeForest Buckner has taken a familiar approach in his attempt to return from a neck injury. The Indianapolis Colts’ veteran defensive tackle posted on social media Friday that he traveled to Panama this week to receive stem cell injections as part of his treatment for a neck injury that resulted in him being [...]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 441: Bye Week Blitz
items.summary: With the Indianapolis Colts on the bye week, the Colts Blue Zone crew takes a look at what's worked so far this season and explores some areas where the team can improve as Indy hits the home stretch. At 8-2, the Colts sit atop the AFC South and boast one of the league's top offenses. [...]

items.title: Colts’ Jonathan Taylor AFC Offensive Player of the Week
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The honors keep flowing in for Jonathan Taylor. The Indianapolis Colts’ veteran running back has been named AFC Offensive Player of the Week after being the catalyst for Sunday’s 31-25 overtime win over the Atlanta Falcons in Berlin. Taylor rushed 32 times for 244 yards and three touchdowns and added three receptions for [...]

items.title: Matt Taylor discusses calling Colts game in Berlin
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts came away with a thrilling 31-25 overtime win against the Atlanta Falcons. This was anything but a typical NFL matchup, as the team traveled to Germany for a "home game." Matt Taylor, radio voice of the Colts, appeared on FOX59 Morning News to discuss the unique experience of calling the Nov. 9 [...]

items.title: Colts, Kicking The Stigma encourage fans to focus on mental health during bye week
items.summary: The Colts' digital and social media channels will not publish content between Wednesday morning and Monday morning, and we encourage fans to take disconnect from devices during the bye week as well.

Item 2: Jonathan Taylor has positioned himself to be the first running [...]

items.title: 5 Colts Things: More context for Jonathan Taylor's 17 touchdowns, plus Tyler Warren, Daniel Jones, Zaire Franklin and special teams make key plays to push Colts to 8-2 at bye week
items.summary: The Colts' 31-25 overtime win over the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday sent them into their bye week with an 8-2 record and a 2.5-game lead in the AFC South.

items.title: Around the AFC South: Texans score 26 points in fourth quarter to take down Jaguars
items.summary: With their overtime win over the Falcons on Sunday, the 8-2 Colts remain firmly in first place in the AFC South.

items.title: Colts fans from all over the world deliver remarkable atmosphere in Berlin before, during and after incredible overtime win over Falcons
items.summary: Colts fans from several continents descended upon Berlin this week to create a special environment of different cultures coming together because of one central thing: A love and passion for the Indianapolis Colts.

items.title: Jonathan Taylor nominated for Week 10 FedEx Ground Player of the Week
items.summary: Taylor recorded 286 scrimmage yards (244 rushing, 44 receiving) and three rushing touchdowns in the Colts' OT win over the Falcons.
